speedGuideContent.intro: Token generation speed directly impacts user experience in AI applications. Research shows delays over 3 seconds significantly increase user abandonment rates.

useTool.title: Use this tool to:
useTool.description: Test optimal speeds for chatbots (15-30 tokens/sec), content tools (40+ tokens/sec), or educational platforms (5-15 tokens/sec). Find the sweet spot between performance and user experience.

tokenGuide.colorBlocks: Each colored block represents one token
tokenGuide.hover: Hover over tokens to see their IDs
tokenGuide.hfModels: ü§ó models use Hugging Face community tokenizers

hfSection.title: Hugging Face Community Tokenizer

communityTokenizers.title: Community tokenizers
communityTokenizers.description: Maintained by the open source community

hfSection.firstLoad: First load may take time to download the tokenizer

usageTips.title: Tokenizer Types:
usageTips.communityTokenizers: Hugging Face community tokenizers (very good approximation)
usageTips.communityAccuracy: Community tokenizers are reverse-engineered but quite accurate
usageTips.localRun: All tokenizers now run locally in your browser!

costEstimation.title: üí∞ API Cost Estimation
costEstimation.description: Understanding token counts is crucial for cost management. For example:

examples.gpt4o: GPT-4o: $15/1M input tokens - A 1000-token prompt costs ~$0.015
examples.claude: Claude 3.5 Sonnet: $3/1M tokens - Same prompt costs ~$0.003
examples.gemini: Gemini 1.5 Pro: $1.25/1M tokens - Same prompt costs ~$0.00125

costEstimation.tip: Use our calculator to estimate costs before scaling your application.

businessScenarios.title: üéØ Business Scenarios
businessScenarios.contentGeneration: Content Generation: Pre-calculate token limits for blog posts, marketing copy
businessScenarios.customerSupport: Customer Support: Optimize chatbot responses to stay within context windows
businessScenarios.documentAnalysis: Document Analysis: Chunk large documents efficiently for processing
businessScenarios.apiIntegration: API Integration: Validate input size before expensive API calls

optimizationStrategies.title: ‚ö° Optimization Strategies
optimizationStrategies.modelSelection: Model Selection: Use cheaper models for simple tasks, premium for complex ones
optimizationStrategies.promptEngineering: Prompt Engineering: Shorter, more specific prompts often yield better results
optimizationStrategies.contextManagement: Context Management: Monitor conversation length to avoid hitting limits
optimizationStrategies.batchProcessing: Batch Processing: Combine multiple requests to reduce overhead

proTip.title: üí° Pro Tip:
proTip.content: Different tokenizers can produce 20-40% variation in token counts for the same text. Test with your target model's tokenizer for accurate cost estimation.

gpu.selectionGuide: GPU Selection Guide for LLM Deployment

budgetOptions.title: üí∞ Budget-Friendly Options (Under $10k)
budgetOptions.rtx4090: RTX 4090 (24GB): Best for 7B-13B models, single card setup
budgetOptions.rtx3090: RTX 3090 (24GB): Good value for smaller models and experimentation
budgetOptions.rtx4060ti: Multiple RTX 4060 Ti (16GB): Cost-effective for distributed inference

enterpriseSolutions.title: üè¢ Enterprise Solutions ($50k+)
enterpriseSolutions.h100: NVIDIA H100 (80GB): Industry standard for production LLM deployment
enterpriseSolutions.a100: NVIDIA A100 (80GB): Proven reliability, good for 70B+ models
enterpriseSolutions.mi300x: AMD MI300X (192GB): Highest memory capacity, excellent for largest models

proTips.title: ‚ö° Pro Tips for Optimization
proTips.fp8: Use FP8/INT8: Reduce memory usage by 50-75% with minimal quality loss
proTips.moe: Consider MoE Models: Qwen3-235B-A22B offers flagship performance with 4x H100 (vs 10x for DeepSeek-R1)
proTips.parallel: Model Parallelism: Split large models across multiple GPUs
proTips.precision: Mixed Precision: Combine FP16 inference with FP32 gradients for training
proTips.mapping: Memory Mapping: Use CPU RAM for model storage, GPU for active layers

qwen.title: üÜï Qwen2.5 & Qwen3 GPU Requirements
qwen.description: Qwen2.5-72B & Qwen3-235B-A22B are the latest flagship models. Qwen2.5-72B needs 2x H100 with FP8, while Qwen3-235B-A22B (MoE) needs 4x H100. The Qwen2.5 series offers excellent multilingual capabilities with efficient deployment.

deepseek.title: DeepSeek R1 GPU Requirements
deepseek.description: DeepSeek R1 (671B parameters) requires substantial GPU memory. With FP8 precision, you'll need approximately 10x NVIDIA H100 GPUs or equivalent high-memory configurations for optimal inference performance.

llama70b.title: Llama 3.1 70B GPU Requirements
llama70b.description: Llama 3.1 70B is more accessible. With FP16 precision, you'll need 2x NVIDIA A100 (80GB) or H100. For consumer hardware, you'll need 7x RTX 4090 cards (24GB each).

llama405b.title: Llama 3.1 405B GPU Requirements
llama405b.description: Llama 3.1 405B requires high-end infrastructure. With FP8 precision, you'll need 6x H100 GPUs. With FP16 precision, you'll need 11x A100 GPUs for deployment.

models.footer: Use this calculator to get precise memory requirements for your specific use case and budget planning.
